page.title: 04Housing 2
page.content: { In the N.W. plain two styles of {FARM HOUSES}predominate. There is the large Georgian house with sash windows and a fan-light above the door.It is set on a lawn with a monkey puzzle or weeping willow in the centre of the grass. There is a smaller style of{FARMHOUSE with a window on each side of the door and three above.The porch has its own little roof.There is a flower garden enclosed in a low wall.Both{FARM HOUSE styles have extensive out-buildings. In the Ballycraigy,Kingsmoss area,derelict{COTTAGES}have been fixed up to make picturesque homes. There is a growing number of{LUXURY {HOMES}being built here,owned by rich business men.They have big landscaped gardens,stables and paddocks. Farmers have also built similar{LUXURY HOMES.
